Our chartered OPV was operational for 335 days and provided a robust platform for fisheries inspections leading to a total of 40 inspections and 5 suspected infringements detected.
 
#WeAssist https://t.co/3Us8Y4jTnA

The Tripartite Working Agreement between EFCA, @EMSA_LISBON and @Frontex set the foundations for a framework of cooperation which aims to support national authorities carrying out Coast Guard Functions and to provide assistance and expertise on coordination and fisheries control. https://t.co/I6Jb12R2U1

In the international dimension of the CFP, we continued to assist @EU_MARE in its cooperation with third countries and international organisations dealing with #fisheries such as Regional Fisheries Management Organisations to strengthen operational coordination and compliance. https://t.co/CLps16kwZI

We provided assistance to the MS regional Control Expert Groups (CEGs) in areas such as achieving a common understanding on the application of technical measures from the perspective of control and inspection, and the implementation of the Landing Obligation.
 
#WeAssist https://t.co/wID9jtYa5b

All 6 JDPs were implemented as planned, with some adjustments due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

We gave assistance to the MS and the @EU_Commission in the areas of control, inspection & surveillance.  These efforts led to 38 452 inspections & 1 787 suspected infringements detected. https://t.co/RUrvkc6Y0Z

#DidYouKnow? The Landing Obligation (#LO) requires all catches of regulated commercial species to be landed and counted against quota, with the aim of promoting sustainable fisheries. One of #EFCA‚Äôs most important tasks is to support its uniform implementation. #EFCApediaüêü https://t.co/RN4k611cor

When inspectors sample catches of certain species, if the quantities of juvenile fish exceeds a certain threshold, the area can be closed to certain fishing gears, for a given period, as an #EUüá™üá∫ conservation measure. These are known as Real Time Closures (RTC). #EFCApedia 2/2 https://t.co/aUOR0g6xQ5
@EFCA_EU @Frontex @EU_MARE @VSinkevicius @vitcheva_eu @EP_Fisheries @FAOfish @LDAC_eu @UN_FAO_GFCM @SARGalileo @ICES_ASC @Pierre_Ka sink 'em !!!

The #EFCA-chartered #LundySentinel is the #EU Agency-led fisheries inspection platform that, together with other #MS assets, patrols the oceans and seas ensuring a culture of compliance where no illegal fisheries activities are allowed, both in EU and international waters. [6/6] https://t.co/mxmQn57iaD

Control technologies are critical to combat #IUU fishing. Good examples of this are the use of #EFCA Integrated Maritime Services and shared capacities of other #EUAgencies, e.g. @CopernicusCMS & #RPAS operations to enhance fisheries monitoring, control and surveillance. [5/6] https://t.co/LaQ3m3r2A3

The #EU funded #PESCAO project aims to prevent & eliminate #IUU fishing, thus contributing to better fisheries governance and food security in Western Africa. We provide capacity building to @CSRP2016 & @FCWC_CPCO and share control expertise gained in the EU context. [4/6] https://t.co/V2aaYyjLc2

Among other measures, #IUU Regulation introduced a catch certification scheme for the import of non-EU fisheries products to the #EU market. #EFCA provides expertise to #MS and @EU_MARE regarding the practical implementation of this traceability tool. #WeAssist [3/6] https://t.co/FVu0xDaaoX

Training is an important task. It helps Member States #MS fulfil their obligations under the #IUU Regulation, raising awareness and providing guidance on technical issues, allowing the exchange of experiences and establishing a network of cooperation. #WeCoordinate [2/6] https://t.co/3oyswtYjDu

@EFCA_EU @CEPESCA @ArviInnovapesca @Delbarcoalamesa @opplugo @DeMerluza @_Opagac @anabac_optuc @carbopesca @_Balfego @fecopesca @PescanovaCorp Muchas gracias por vuestras palabras en estos momentos tan complicados
@EFCA_EU @EU_MARE @EP_Fisheries @maritimeCyprus @Mipaaf_ @SGMer @MinagricPress @agriculture_ie @keskkonnamin @mmm_fi @bmel @minlnv Great initiatives

#EFCA‚Äôs chartered OPV (Offshore Patrol Vessel), the #LundySentinel, was operational for 308 days and provided a robust platform for fisheries inspections leading to a total of 247 inspections and 136 suspected infringements detected. [END THREAD] https://t.co/s0UaGplHp2

Cooperation with @Frontex and @EMSA_LISBON further developed in the area of capacity building with #EFCA coordinating the overall drafting process of the Practical Handbook on European Cooperation on #CoastGuard Functions. #WeCoordinate [7/8] https://t.co/rdvUoQ2zh9

In the framework of the five-year #EUüá™üá∫ funded #PESCAO project, including a component aiming to improve the fight against #IUU fishing activities in #WesternAfrica, #EFCA continued to provide technical assistance. #WeAssist [6/8] https://t.co/gqviC7rN8v

#EFCA also assisted @EU_MARE in its cooperation with international organisations dealing with #fisheries such as Regional Fisheries Management Organisations (@NAFO1979, #NEAFC, #ICCAT & @UN_FAO_GFCM), to strengthen operational coordination & compliance. #WeCoordinate [5/8]

#EFCA used the framework of the JDPs to enhance the standardisation of inspections. The publication of technical guidelines was another important milestone in EFCA‚Äôs work in this area. Over 1,000 staff are now registered in the EFCA e-learning platform. #WeInnovate [4/8] https://t.co/XXv3tQk7sS

#EFCA contributed to the work of the MS CEGs, focusing on the implementation of the Landing Obligation, worked on compliance evaluation exercises focused on the #LO in various areas, and worked with CEGs on the development of a REM pilot project template. #WeCoordinate [3/8] https://t.co/Dic5EtqZCl

Control, inspection and surveillance activities coordinated by #EFCA increased in 2019. Cooperative efforts led to 32,381 coordinated inspections, 20.28% more than in 2018, & to 1,487 suspected infringements detected, an increase of 108.26% compared to 2018. #WeCoordinate [2/8] https://t.co/SKcPbWnC2o
